growing.zone: 5-9 (can be grown as an annual or overwintered indoors in cooler zones)
growing.water: Low once established; prefers dry conditions and hates wet roots
growing.soil: Well-drained, sandy or rocky soil with neutral to slightly alkaline pH (6.5-8)

planting.whenToPlant: Spring after last frost or fall in mild climates
planting.propagation: Best by softwood cuttings; seeds are slow and variable in germination
planting.depth: Surface sow seeds or plant cuttings at soil level

careAndMaintenance.pruning: Lightly prune after flowering to maintain shape; harder prune in spring to encourage bushiness
careAndMaintenance.stakingOrSupport: May need light support in windy areas or for taller varieties
careAndMaintenance.overwintering: Mulch lightly in fall in colder zones; container plants can be moved indoors

harvestingAndUsage.whenToHarvest: When 1/3 to 1/2 of the flower buds are open for best fragrance and oil content
harvestingAndUsage.howToHarvest: Cut stems early in the day after dew has dried; bundle and hang upside down to dry
harvestingAndUsage.preservation: Air dry in bundles; store dried flowers in airtight containers away from light
harvestingAndUsage.edibleOrToxic: Edible in small quantities (culinary lavender); large amounts may cause digestive upset. Essential oil is not for internal use.
harvestingAndUsage.culinary: Used sparingly in desserts, syrups, teas, and as part of Herbes de Provence blend

medicinal.Relaxation & Anxiety: Lavender is widely used in aromatherapy to promote calm and reduce stress. Scientific studies support mild sedative effects.
medicinal.Sleep Aid: Often used in sachets or oils to improve sleep quality and ease insomnia.
medicinal.Digestive Health: Traditional use for soothing stomach discomfort; lavender tea is mildly carminative.
medicinal.Skin Support: Lavender oil is applied (diluted) to minor burns, cuts, and insect bites for its antimicrobial and soothing properties.
medicinal.Headache Relief: Inhalation of lavender aroma or applying diluted oil to temples may help relieve tension headaches.

harvestingAndUsage.aromatic: Strong, sweet, floral scent; valued for perfumes, sachets, and essential oils

ecologicalInfo.wildlifeResistance: Deer and rabbits usually avoid lavender due to its strong scent
